skill.name: generate-image
skill.description: Generate or edit images using AI models (FLUX, Gemini). Use for general-purpose image generation including photos, illustrations, artwork, visual assets, concept art, and any image that is not a technical diagram or schematic. For flowcharts, circuits, pathways, and technical diagrams, use the scientific-schematics skill instead.
skill.summary: Generate or edit images using AI models (FLUX, Gemini) through OpenRouter API for creating photos, illustrations, artwork, and visual content.
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Legitimate image generation skill with standard API integration. Network access to openrouter.ai for image generation, filesystem access for reading input images and saving outputs, and .env file access for API key retrieval. All detected patterns align with expected functionality. Base64 encoding flagged as weak crypto is a false positive. Base64 is encoding, not encryption, and is used to decode API image responses. External command references in SKILL.md are documentation examples, not runtime execution.

content.user_title: Generate AI Images with FLUX and Gemini
content.value_statement: Creating visual assets requires specialized tools and design skills. This skill enables AI-powered image generation and editing through OpenRouter, supporting FLUX and Gemini models for creating photos, illustrations, artwork, and visual concepts.
actual_capabilities: Generate images from text prompts using FLUX or Gemini models through OpenRouter API
Edit existing images with AI-powered modifications including color and background changes
Save generated images in PNG format with automatic base64 decoding of API responses
Support multiple image generation models including black-forest-labs/flux.2-pro and google/gemini-3-pro
limitations: Requires valid OpenRouter API key configured in .env file
Image editing only supported on FLUX.2 Pro and Gemini 3 Pro models
Generation time varies by model, typically 5-30 seconds per image
No batch processing support, requires separate API calls for multiple images

use_cases.title: Create visual assets for documents and presentations
use_cases.description: Generate professional illustrations and images for slides, reports, and documentation without external design tools.

use_cases.title: Edit and enhance existing images
use_cases.description: Modify photos and images with AI-powered editing commands like color adjustments, background changes, or object modifications.

use_cases.title: Produce concept art and creative visuals
use_cases.description: Generate artistic illustrations, concept art, and creative visuals from textual descriptions for brainstorming and prototyping.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Image Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an image of [describe your desired image in detail]. Output the result to [filename].png
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple image creation with default Gemini model

prompt_templates.title: FLUX Model Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the FLUX.2 Pro model to generate: [detailed prompt]. Save as [filename].png
prompt_templates.scenario: When you prefer FLUX model for image generation

prompt_templates.title: Image Editing
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit the image at [input_path] by [describe modifications]. Save as [output_path].png
prompt_templates.scenario: Modifying an existing image with AI

prompt_templates.title: Creative Illustration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [style] illustration of [subject]. Save to [path]

output_examples.input: Generate a professional team collaboration scene for documentation
output_examples.output: AI generates and saves a team collaboration image to the specified output path as team_collaboration.png

output_examples.input: Edit photo.jpg to change the sky to sunset colors
output_examples.output: AI edits the image and saves with sunset-colored sky as edited_photo.png

best_practices: Be specific and detailed in prompts for better image quality
Use FLUX.2 Pro or Gemini 3 Pro models for editing capabilities
Save images with descriptive filenames for easy tracking
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts like make it look good instead of specific descriptions
Forgetting to configure OPENROUTER_API_KEY before running the skill
Trying to edit images with models that do not support editing

faq.question: What API key do I need?
faq.answer: You need an OpenRouter API key. Get one at openrouter.ai/keys and add it to a .env file as OPENROUTER_API_KEY=your-key.

faq.question: Which models support image editing?
faq.answer: Both google/gemini-3-pro-image-preview and black-forest-labs/flux.2-pro support image editing. The flux.2-flex model is generation only.

faq.question: What image formats are supported?
faq.answer: Input images can be PNG, JPEG, GIF, or WebP. Generated images are saved as PNG files.

faq.question: How long does generation take?
faq.answer: Generation typically takes 5-30 seconds depending on the model and complexity. FLUX models are generally faster than Gemini.

faq.question: Can I use this for technical diagrams?
faq.answer: No. For flowcharts, circuits, and technical diagrams, use the scientific-schematics skill instead. This skill is for photos, illustrations, and artwork.

faq.question: How much does it cost?
faq.answer: Costs vary by model. Check OpenRouter pricing at openrouter.ai/models before use. API costs are billed directly by OpenRouter.
